components.title: Section 13 - Authorizations for Discharges to the Environment

components.html: In situ treatment of contaminants may generate substances which could be deemed a waste requiring a discharge authorization, even though there is no end-of-the-pipe from the site. Contravention of the requirements for an authorization is an offense and may be subject to penalties.
components.label: Text/Images
Did or does a discharge associated with the remediation require an authorization under the Environmental Management Act?
Provide the authorization numbers under the Environmental Management Act for any air, effluent and soil discharges to the environment for treatment works located at the site.
I confirm that the above information is true based on my knowledge as of the date this notification form was completed.
